Headline: Take a bow: Singaporean violinist scores Grade 8 distinction at 5 years old, Life News & Top Stories - The Straits Times
Text: Read 3 articles daily and stand to win ST rewards, including the ST News Tablet worth $398.Spin the wheel for ST Read and Win now.SINGAPORE - When five-year-old Travis Wong achieved distinction in the Grade 8 violin performance examination conducted by London-based Associated Board of the Royal Schools of Music (ABRSM) in April, his family was surprised.Travis, who turned six last month, picked up the violin when he was three. He had less than four months to master four pieces of music after his first test, the Grade 5 violin performance exam, last December.Please subscribe or log in  to continue reading the full article.*Terms and conditions apply.
